channel.title: Lucid Dreaming and Astral Projection
channel.description:
Does anyone have any experience with either of these?
My experiences with lucid dreaming always become apparent when I check my hands in the dream. Its something I do all the time so when I do it in my dreams I realize that I am dreaming and become lucid. Everyone of my lucid dreams always ends with me about to start flying :(
My astral projection experience is non-existent and im still sceptical to if it exists.

item.title: Lucid Dreaming and Astral Projection
item.dc:creator: @rip4d rip4d
item.description:
@rip4d wrote:

Well I just had another lucid dream last night I swear, I LOVE the feeling of being lucid… but I just want to always do the stupidest things ever… I tried putting my hand through a wall in my dream last night and was disappointed when it didn’t work

Read full topic

item.title: Lucid Dreaming and Astral Projection
item.dc:creator: @Andrew_Ferguson The317Guy
item.description:
@Andrew_Ferguson wrote:

[quote=“Saphire`, post:48, topic:399136”]Believe me the stress I’m under aint worth it. Maybe if it was planned and I was financally stable it would be different. But the anxiety I have right now doesnt feel good.

  • using mobile so excuse my grammar because my calibration is a little out sp some letters don’t work. :P[/quote]
    naww I almost had one about 3 weeks ago, false alarm, I secretly want one more then anything but my girl doesn’t really feel the same.

Read full topic

item.title: Lucid Dreaming and Astral Projection
item.dc:creator: @Andrew_Ferguson The317Guy
item.description:
@Andrew_Ferguson wrote:

[quote=“Saphire`, post:46, topic:399136”]Since I found out my girlfriend is pregnant I have been having some strange dreams and lucid dreams. I would awake in my house and find my partner in labour on the floor, I get a huge sensation of panic run through my body and then I realize I’m in a dream.

I wake up just before she gives birth though, kind of disappointing. :([/quote]
Lucky, I want a baby.

Read full topic

item.title: Lucid Dreaming and Astral Projection
item.dc:creator: @Saphire1 Saphire`
item.description:
@Saphire1 wrote:

Since I found out my girlfriend is pregnant I have been having some strange dreams and lucid dreams. I would awake in my house and find my partner in labour on the floor, I get a huge sensation of panic run through my body and then I realize I’m in a dream.

I wake up just before she gives birth though, kind of disappointing.

item.title: Lucid Dreaming and Astral Projection
item.dc:creator: @Diligo_Deum Diligo Deum
item.description:
@Diligo_Deum wrote:

[quote=“Jerico Pimpinbro, post:37, topic:399136”][quote author=Diligo Deum link=topic=496269.msg3637086#msg3637086 date=1308676261]
What the hell? I just looked lucid dreaming up: I always know I’m dreaming WTF. Are you seriously so stupid you don’t know that you’re dreaming? o.O

Okay looked up astral projections, I can do that anytime I want lol… like if I looked at a corner and closed my eyes I could see and move around the corner and know exactly what everything looks like from that “camera”
[/quote]

If you have an I.Q. >5 you should be capable of knowing when and when you’re not dreaming. Lucid dreaming is being able to control your actions in a dream, which you aren’t able to do when you’re normally dreaming. Try them both and see the difference.[/quote]I can always control what I do in a dream lol. That’s why it’s “my dream”?

Read full topic

item.title: Lucid Dreaming and Astral Projection
item.dc:creator: @pk2play pk2play
item.description:
@pk2play wrote:

Read full topic

item.title: Lucid Dreaming and Astral Projection
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

I’ve never had a lucid dream but from what I’ve read it sounds like an interesting experience. Any tips on getting into one?

Read full topic

item.title: Lucid Dreaming and Astral Projection
item.dc:creator: @Stupit Stu
item.description:
@Stupit wrote:

[quote=“Andrew Ferguson, post:41, topic:399136”][quote author=Stupit link=topic=496269.msg3632041#msg3632041 date=1308315152]

There have been a few times when I have had lucid dreams without waking up and normally it involves me having sex with a few choice women.

I have those dreams, except I wake up before I put it in. -.-
[/quote]Probably because you get too excited, therefore waking up.

Actually, I’ve heard it’s because your body hasn’t experienced sex yet, so it doesn’t know what to do. That’s just assuming Marine is a virgin though.

I’m quite sure anyone knows. Hell, my 11 year old brother knows what sex is.

I learned when I was 6 because I saw some graffiti with the word sex in it so I googled it and stopped eating for a week. I pretended I didn’t know about it till I was 10. Lol[/quote]
I learned what sex/loving quite early in life also.

Read full topic

I learned when I was 6 because I saw some graffiti with the word sex in it so I googled it and stopped eating for a week. I pretended I didn’t know about it till I was 10. Lol

item.title: Lucid Dreaming and Astral Projection
item.dc:creator: @I_Am_Sparc I Am Sparc
item.description:
@I_Am_Sparc wrote:

Everytime I become Lucid, in my dreams I’m either railing a girl or being killed by zombies. I also had one where I was smoking weed and the weed turned into a finger and I woke up screaming. o.o

Read full topic

item.title: Lucid Dreaming and Astral Projection
item.dc:creator: @rip4d rip4d
item.description:
@rip4d wrote:

So, has anyone been keeping a dream journal at all? I’ve been doing it the past week, and whenever I read the page I instantly remember that dream now Its so funny knowing that Selena Gomez was a prostitute in one of your dreams <3

Read full topic

item.title: Lucid Dreaming and Astral Projection
item.dc:creator: @Jerico_Pimpinbro Jerico Pimpinbro
item.description:
@Jerico_Pimpinbro wrote:

[quote=“Diligo Deum, post:35, topic:399136”]What the hell? I just looked lucid dreaming up: I always know I’m dreaming WTF. Are you seriously so stupid you don’t know that you’re dreaming? o.O

Okay looked up astral projections, I can do that anytime I want lol… like if I looked at a corner and closed my eyes I could see and move around the corner and know exactly what everything looks like from that “camera”[/quote]

If you have an I.Q. >5 you should be capable of knowing when and when you’re not dreaming. Lucid dreaming is being able to control your actions in a dream, which you aren’t able to do when you’re normally dreaming. Try them both and see the difference.

Read full topic

item.title: Lucid Dreaming and Astral Projection
item.dc:creator: @asyo4 asyo4
item.description:
@asyo4 wrote:

This is a very interesting concept, however I think astral projection is more of a religious-based act more than a general one. I had a few lucidical dreams here and there and I got to admit they are very unique as every each one is different. There is actually a forum entirely based on these dreams, however I will not post the link as I do not wish to advertise it.

Read full topic

item.title: Lucid Dreaming and Astral Projection
item.dc:creator: @Ix_Soulcist_xI Soulcist
item.description:
@Ix_Soulcist_xI wrote:

rip4d:

To be lucid just means to realize you are dreaming, and at which point you can take control.

Oh then that experience I had defiantly wasn’t lucid. Tell you what though, I can go back to sleep and dream about the same dream easily.

Also in that case, I’ve dreamed lucid a lot then.

Read full topic

Only time I’ve had a lucid dream is when it’s a bad dream. I’m usually to freaked out to do anything cool and I’ll force myself to wake up.
